descr.p: "Fallin' In Love" is an American pop music song recorded and released by the trio of Hamilton, Joe Frank & Reynolds. The song was written by band member Dan Hamilton. Released in the summer of 1975, the song became the group's second Top 10 hit on the Billboard Hot 100 chart in the U.S. (following 1971's "Don't Pull Your Love", which peaked at #4), and it was their only song to reach the #1 position on this chart. It was also the only pop #1 hit for the Playboy Records label.
The song reached #24 on Billboard's Hot Soul Singles chart. In addition, "Fallin' in Love" was a #1 hit on the adult contemporary chart in the U.S. for one week in 1975.
The song was covered by La Bouche in 1995 on their debut album Sweet Dreams, and sampled by Drake for his single "Best I Ever Had".
